Award.AwardTitle: A demonstration platform to enhance the diffusion of SCISIP research

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Social, Behav & Economic Scie

Award.AbstractNarration:
Research relies on access to carefully archived data, and critical tools, including visualizations, analytic models,and computer code. The Science of Science and Innovation Policy (SciSIP) program has reached a juncture in the production of research output. This project builds a central repository where the products from SciSIP's publicly funded research are available to be accessed, appreciated and augmented. Promoting the generation and availability of publicly funded data and research tools is a key way to accomplish the mission of the SciSIP program, which is to produce and provide high quality, policy-relevant research to policymakers.

This proposal builds a platform that publicizes SciSIP research and makes data, tools and code available for download. The objective is to facilitate scholarly exchanges between SciSIP award recipients and foster intellectual exchange among funded researchers of the SciSIP program and policy practitioners.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The U.S. Government invests billions of dollars in science and technology research every year. Ideally, this investment diffuses quickly and deeply across our economy and society and improves the lives of as many Americans as possible. This demonstration platform illustrated how scientists and engineers can easily improve the reach and impact of their ideas, through easy to use ingestion tools and an automatically generated website.

The creation of such a centralized website enables Principal Investigators to quickly get their publications in front of a much bigger audience. If such a website and ingestion process was adopted across government funding agencies, it would enhance the diffusion of research results, technologies, and ideas. The attached figures illustrate how news can be easily curated for policy makers and the press. Additional linkages make it easy to see all of a Principal Investigator's work and co-authors.

This particular website highlights NSF social science -- which focuses on inventors, scientists, and the effectiveness of science policy. This work haspotential to improve the impact of science research on the economy and society.

While these ingestion and websites technologies are not new, the demonstration platform illustrates how a bit more and carefully aimed investment could increase our society's return on investment in science and technology. Given the many challenges we currently face, including the pandemic, global warming, and racial and social inequity, it behooves us to get the maximum bang for our research buck.
